heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 13 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 7.2°C) and outside temperature (down 6.3°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.9 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 427 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1032 m), feels like temperature (up 11.3°C), outside temperature (up 9.2°C), and dew point temperature (up 6.3°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 427.4m lower than yesterday, 664.5m lower than the past week, 1032.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 845m to a maximum of 3460m, averaging 1159.2m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1823.8m and 2190m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and very little to no wind will be present. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dark. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
